securityKeys.description: The registered security key credentials for a user.

posixAccounts.description: The list of POSIX accounts associated with the user.

sshPublicKeys.description: A map from SSH public key fingerprint to the associated key object.

LoginProfile.description: The user profile information used for logging in to a virtual machine on Google Compute Engine.

name.description: Output only. The canonical resource name.

key.description: Public key text in SSH format, defined by RFC4253 section 6.6.

expirationTimeUsec.description: An expiration time in microseconds since epoch.

fingerprint.description: Output only. The SHA-256 fingerprint of the SSH public key.

SshPublicKey.description: The SSH public key information associated with a Google account.

appId.description: Application ID for the U2F protocol.

UniversalTwoFactor.description: Security key information specific to the U2F protocol.

PosixAccount.description: The POSIX account information associated with a Google account.

accountId.description: Output only. A POSIX account identifier.

primary.description: Only one POSIX account can be marked as primary.

shell.description: The path to the logic shell for this account.

homeDirectory.description: The path to the home directory for this account.

username.description: The username of the POSIX account.

gecos.description: The GECOS (user information) entry for this account.

name.description: Output only. The canonical resource name.

operatingSystemType.description: The operating system type where this account applies.
enumDescriptions: The operating system type associated with the user account information is unspecified.

systemId.description: System identifier for which account the username or uid applies to. By default, the empty value is used.

WebAuthn.description: Security key information specific to the Web Authentication protocol.

rpId.description: Relying party ID for Web Authentication.

Empty.description: A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request or the response type of an API method. For instance: service Foo { rpc Bar(google.protobuf.Empty) returns (google.protobuf.Empty); }

ImportSshPublicKeyResponse.description: A response message for importing an SSH public key.

loginProfile.description: The login profile information for the user.

SecurityKey.description: The credential information for a Google registered security key.

privateKey.description: Hardware-backed private key text in SSH format.

publicKey.description: Public key text in SSH format, defined by [RFC4253]("https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4253.txt") section 6.6.

description: You can use OS Login to manage access to your VM instances using IAM roles.
title: Cloud OS Login API

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: See, edit, configure, and delete your Google Cloud data and see the email address for your Google Account.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/compute..description: View your Google Compute Engine resources

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/compute.description: View and manage your Google Compute Engine resources

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/cloud-pl.description: View your data across Google Cloud services and see the email address of your Google Account

operatingSystemType.description: The type of operating system associated with the account.
enumDescriptions: The operating system type associated with the user account information is unspecified.

name.description: Required. A reference to the POSIX account to update. POSIX accounts are identified by the project ID they are associated with. A reference to the POSIX account is in format `users/{user}/projects/{project}`.

patch.description: Updates an SSH public key and returns the profile information. This method supports patch semantics.

name.description: Required. The fingerprint of the public key to update. Public keys are identified by their SHA-256 fingerprint. The fingerprint of the public key is in format `users/{user}/sshPublicKeys/{fingerprint}`.

updateMask.description: Mask to control which fields get updated. Updates all if not present.

name.description: Required. The fingerprint of the public key to retrieve. Public keys are identified by their SHA-256 fingerprint. The fingerprint of the public key is in format `users/{user}/sshPublicKeys/{fingerprint}`.

parent.description: Required. The unique ID for the user in format `users/{user}`.

name.description: Required. The fingerprint of the public key to update. Public keys are identified by their SHA-256 fingerprint. The fingerprint of the public key is in format `users/{user}/sshPublicKeys/{fingerprint}`.

systemId.description: A system ID for filtering the results of the request.

projectId.description: The project ID of the Google Cloud Platform project.

operatingSystemType.description: The type of operating system associated with the account.
enumDescriptions: The operating system type associated with the user account information is unspecified.

view.description: The view configures whether to retrieve security keys information.
enumDescriptions: The default login profile view. The API defaults to the BASIC view.
Includes POSIX and SSH key information.
Include security key information for the user.

name.description: Required. The unique ID for the user in format `users/{user}`.

getLoginProfile.description: Retrieves the profile information used for logging in to a virtual machine on Google Compute Engine.

importSshPublicKey.description: Adds an SSH public key and returns the profile information. Default POSIX account information is set when no username and UID exist as part of the login profile.

parent.description: The unique ID for the user in format `users/{user}`.

view.description: The view configures whether to retrieve security keys information.
enumDescriptions: The default login profile view. The API defaults to the BASIC view.
Includes POSIX and SSH key information.
Include security key information for the user.

projectId.description: The project ID of the Google Cloud Platform project.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

name: oslogin
